title: Flight Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND)
Interview Descriptions: You take a test in one of the classrooms with the other applicants, instrument approach in a simulator, and a five minute interview about yourself and a couple technical questions.
Interview Questions: How are you better than the other applicants out there.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Dakota
Interview Descriptions: In my interview i have had simple questions, mostly non-technical. the interview was not that long, and the interviewers were friendly. you dont really need to have strong technical background to able to apply to this job.
Interview Questions: what are the main differences between Newtonian and non-Newtonian fluids?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Dakota
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy, they ask questions that matter and get straight to the point about everything. Very efficient and a good process overall. They ask what hours you can work and respect it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Student IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Dakota
Interview Descriptions: The interview was virtual with four members of the IT staff. They mostly asked questions relating to IT support. It was an easy interview though some questions were poorly phrased.
Interview Questions: Varies questions about my background and troubleshooting.

title: Flight Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Dakota
Interview Descriptions: Applicants complete a knowledge exam, then applicants are narrowed down and interviewed with someone from management (asst chief flight instructor, lead CFI, etc.), after that applicants conduct an instrument approach in the simulator.
Interview Questions: What sets you apart from other instructors?

title: Research and Education Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a smooth well-planned out interview process. The second round interview was a full-day via zoom, but they included lots of breaks and made it as close to a site-visit as possible.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my experiences teaching and assisting patrons.

title: Certified Flight Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Phoenix, AZ) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Online Skype Interview. 
Basic Human Resources  questions followed by teaching a lesson on one of the following subjects:
Hypoxia, Spin Awareness , Required Aircraft Inspections, Pilot Certificate Duration and Currency.
Time for the lesson was about 10 minutes.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses ?

title: Director Aviation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone initial conversation  30 minutes talking about the position they had open and the needs of the position.  Followed by on site interview with panel of 3 people witch lasted about an hour.  Followed later with a casual meeting with other staff during a lunch setting.
Interview Questions: Interest in working overseas in another country

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Dakota
Interview Descriptions: In person day long interview that involved meeting multiple research faculty.  Was able to meet with current students in a small group and later had dinner with the PIs whos lab I was interested in.
Interview Questions: Previous experience and current research interests.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The entire process took 6+ weeks before any decision was made. Questions are not too difficult and great facility tour and lunch with management. A panel with 3-4 people were asking after the introduction
Interview Questions: How do you take lead about your project?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Kenosha, WI) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Easy and quick of interview, present 30mins research work & technical questions for another 20mins; hiring process is not very convenient for international students; salary is below average of USA;
Interview Questions: Present PPT of your PhD research for 30 mins; 20 mins questions; 15 mins self-introduction

title: IT Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Its was a very good interview , I was asked some questions like I can work 30 hours
I have alot of computer skills
I still have 2 years to graduate
Interview Questions:
How many hours you can work?
What is your computer skills?
How long for your graduation?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a relatively easier process. I was aaked about why I wanted to work for the lab, what wanted to archive with my degree and how O think the lab is a good fit. It wasa nice idea to interview with them
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this Lab??

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Dakota in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was over the phone. They then offered you a job over the phone if you were selected. They tell you about the position and what you will be doing in it.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions: tell me about yourself, what you like most and least about your job, etc.

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite fast and pretty straight forward. Within a week or 2 of applying, I received an email to come in for interview in another 1 week. The interview in itself was almost 40 mins long which included me talking about my previous academic and work experience. It involved general questions and also some technical questions about the work that I was being hired for. But nothing too hard.
Interview Questions: Give an example where you faced a problem in your work and how did you solve it?

title: Campus Postal Service Summer Mail Delivery/Processor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The two people in charge showed me around the postal facility and explained the job. Then we went into their office and I was asked if I had any questions.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND)
Interview Descriptions: Very generous in bringing me in to interview in person.  Paid for flights, hotel, meals.  Interview began at 7:30 AM and ended around 5:00 PM, meeting with several different departments.  Everyone was very kind during the interviews.  Met with everyone from the head of the department to assistants.  Was able to ask questions to each member about how their position would work with mine.
Interview Questions: What does working for the University of North Dakota mean to you?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of North Dakota
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process. I applied for the graduate program at in the Communication Program. Upon receiving notification that I was accepted to the graduate program, I was also made aware that I was being offered a position to teaching as a graduate teaching assistant with a stipend as I completed my degree. I never applied or inquired about the job during my school application process. I was never interviewed for the position. I was never asked any questions. The job was simply handed to me and my colleagues, along with the acceptance letter into the program to study.
Interview Questions: Do you have a B.A. in anything?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I got a call form the Petroleum Engineering Department asking when I would like to come in for an interview. I went in and the interviewers were friendly but straight to the point. They had answers for all my questions and I answered theirs as best as I could. Received a call the next week about their decision.
Interview Questions: Why do I think I should be hired for the job?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Dakota in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied to graduate school. A few weeks later a professor emailed me about my experience. A skype interview was set up. Interview lasted about 45 minutes. Technical questions about my resume and classes I had taken, but nothing too crazy. A fair amount of time was spent talking about what type of research is done in the professor's lab and if I was a fit for it.
Interview Questions: Tell me about this internship/class/project?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Dakota
Interview Descriptions: Set up an interview over the phone. Met with lab manager. Interview took five to ten minutes at the most. Very easy questions such as what would you do if you don't know the answer to a question? Almost impossible to fail this interview. Hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness.

title: Bookstore Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the school's student jobs webpage. I got a phone call from my boss the following afternoon. She asked me a few questions about past experiences, why I wanted to work there, my school schedule, when I was graduating and then offered the job over the phone. I started 3 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Past experiences

title: Cold Foods Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process wasn't bad, though there were three people in the interview which was a little intimidating to start with.  The questions were very basic about food work history, general skills, and goals that I had with the job.  The hardest part was probably navigating the website which felt clunky at times.
Interview Questions: How long have you worked in food service.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Online application followed up by an in-person meeting. E-mail contact was consistent and speedy leading up to the interview. The interview was lead by 5 people who were looking primarily at temperament and cultural fit.
Interview Questions: Do you prefer to work alone or in groups?

title: Janitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: interview is generally asking about your background and your character analyze. nothing hard or complex. classic interview questions and little bit more depend on the position applied. it was a nice friendly situation and not pressure to answer every questions right. check for general HR questions for an idea.
Interview Questions: tell me about your previous experience

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview we primarily a short conversation with members of the department - the bulk of the decision is based off of your writing sample and letter. An interview is not required but helpful to securing a position in the department.
Interview Questions:
What do you hope to study?
What are your career goals?

title: Research Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: First interview was technical, second was human resource. the interview panel consisted of four people. 1st interview was focused on technical side, lots of question of past work experience, skills, and acquired talents. second interview was mostly personality questions.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in five years?

title: International Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: applied through the mail 8/9/2012(Who does that anymore?). Had the interview with five different people from different departments.  Each person had at least 3 questions for me.  Did not get the position but they re-posted the position recently for someone who left.  Lots of personality questions.  Based on most of the committees online profiles I was over qualified. Did not receive a call or email saying that I did not get the position.  Totally Unprofessional.
Interview Questions: why do i want to live in North Dakota?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Dakota in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview committee; several rounds of interviews.  Met in-person and discussed the role, its responsibilities, and my background.  Discussed my views on education, advising, and my potential role in the institution.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become an academic advisor

title: Resident Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of North Dakota (Grand Forks, ND) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Nice was along process but worthwhile. Asked many question about diversity in society, etc.
Interview Questions: Nothing special.
